alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:52PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Johnson County through 230 PM MDT... At 151 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Buffalo, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Buffalo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between mile markers 293 and 299. Interstate 90 between mile markers 53 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County
